title: [BUG] SKCanvas.DrawRect incorrectly draws a rectangle via (int, int, int, int) overload
body:
**Description**

SKCanvas.DrawRect incorrectly draws a rectangle via `int, int, int, int` overload

**Code**

```
// correctly draws
SKRect rect = new(x1, y1, x2, y2);
canvas.DrawRect(rect, paint);
```

```
// incorrectly draws
canvas.DrawRect(x1, y1, x2, y2, paint);
```

**Expected Behavior**
```
// correctly draws
SKRect rect = new(x1, y1, x2, y2);
canvas.DrawRect(rect, paint);
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26642847/157590790-a4c37a93-70e5-4a65-aa6f-de515e45d4aa.png)

**Actual Behavior**

```
// incorrectly draws
canvas.DrawRect(x1, y1, x2, y2, paint);
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26642847/157590876-c6b4609f-c086-4dda-8d77-e2f8f030a6a9.png)

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  2.80.3
- Last known good version:  unknown
- IDE: Visual Studio for Mac
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - Android: API 31 Android 12 <!-- the version of the Android SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 7.1 --> 
  - macOS:  10.15.7 Catalina <!-- The version of macOS you are building for, e.g. 10.10 -->
- Target Devices:   <!-- the devices that you noticed this on, e.g. iPhone X -->
  - Samsung S8 <!-- Google Pixel 4 XL -->
  
<details>
  <summary>Detailed IDE/OS information (click to expand)</summary>
